page.title: 05Walton Primary School
page.content: The school was built in 1836. It developed as a{church school}from that date and was known in the village as the National School. Constructed of lias stone with a slate roof, the building has been much modified and modernised over the years. The school house now used as part of the school building, with additional classroom space in a temporary building of rather permanent nature. In common with other eleven year old children in this area, education beyond the primary stage is provided at Crispin School in nearby Street.
